nodes.title: Mercian Elite CK95SC Ultimate V2 Bend Hockey Stick - Elite Composite Solid Core Technology
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Mercian Ultimate V2 Bend Hockey Stick 2025 - Elite Composite Solid Core Technology

Following 3 years of Research & Development and testing, Mercian are able to bring CK95SC Solid Core technology to the market. This stick optimises power, weight, and balance with a vacuum-filled polymeric core, enhancing rigidity and feel. Finally, you can have the touch that a lower carbon stick provides without compromising on carbon and power. Wrapped in high specification Japanese Toray carbon and Tungsten Carbide Diffused Kevlar (TCDK), it uses unique resins for superior laminate bonding, delivering power, precision, and balance.

The Mercian Ultimate V2 Bend, new for 2025, features an aggressive low bow for enhanced drag flicking, aerial skills, and 3D dribbling. It has a thinner toe and sculpted head for better ball control and lifting. Detail: 24.5mm bend at 200mm.

Key Features:

  • CK95SC Solid Core Technology: Optimises power, weight, and balance with a vacuum-filled polymeric core, enhancing rigidity and feel.
  • Toray Carbon: Ultra-light composites with superior strength and rigidity, reducing weight while enhancing mechanical performance.
  • Tungsten Carbide Diffused Kevlar (TCDK): Enhances strength and durability by diffusing tungsten carbide through Kevlar.
  • Nano Polymer Resin: Creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.
  • High-Quality Carbon: Preferred carbon from Japan, Germany, Scotland, and South Africa provides stiffness but can be brittle. Combining carbon with fibreglass and Kevlar enhances strength and durability.
  • High Friction Finish: The final layer of lacquer on the face of the stick is mixed with fine grains of silicon polymer to create a texture that stops the ball spinning on contact. These tiny rubber particles 'squash' on ball impact, providing a damping effect.
  • Dual-Process Vibration Control: Piezo-electric fibres convert vibrations into heat for efficient dampening.

seo.description: Discover the Mercian Ultimate V2 Bend Hockey Stick, featuring CK95SC Solid Core technology for optimized power, weight, balance & feel. Wrapped in TeXtreme carbon & Tungsten Carbide Diffused Kevlar (TCDK), this stick offers superior laminate bonding for enhanced performance. Perfect for drag flicking, aerial skills, & 3D dribbling.

nodes.title: Mercian Elite CF95 Xtreme Bend Hockey Stick - Elite Composite Technology
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Mercian Elite CF95 Xtreme Bend Hockey Stick - Elite Composite Technology

Unlock your potential with the Mercian Elite CF95 Hockey Stick, a premium choice for elite athletes and aspiring intermediate players. Crafted with a 95% carbon lay-up and a fibreglass micro-skeleton, this stick provides exceptional touch and feel, surpassing the CK95 model. The Xtreme bend combines popular features with new elements, including a thinned toe for 3D skills, flattened backhand zone for accuracy, 24.5mm bend, 2mm concave shaft, 4-degree face twist, and thinned handle. Nano polymer resin creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.

Mercianâ€™s QCS technology uses braided carbon strands to create a 360-degree carbon sleeve, providing seamless strength, softer feel, and exceptional energy transfer. Additional sleeves at stress points enhance protection, delivering maximum power and durability.

Key Features:

  • 95% Carbon Construction: Superior stiffness and energy transfer for powerful strikes.
  • Xtreme Bend: 24.5mm bend at 200mm from the head, perfect for drag-flicking and executing advanced skills.
  • Quad-Carbon Sleeve: Provides 360-degree strength, a softer feel, and enhanced power.
  • Advanced Vibration Control: Piezo-electric fibres convert vibrations into heat for efficient dampening.
  • Durable Materials: Nano-polymer resin and Tungsten Carbide diffused Kevlar (TCDK) technology ensure longevity and performance.
  • High Friction Finish: The final layer of lacquer on the face of the stick is mixed with fine grains of silicon polymer to create a texture that stops the ball spinning on contact. These tiny rubber particles 'squash' on ball impact, providing a damping effect.
  • Precision Handling: The Extreme Bend features a thinned toe for easier ball elevation, while the flat backhand zone enhances shooting accuracy.
  • Enhanced Skills: Optimized for elite-level execution, this stick excels in drag flicks, slaps, and 3D dribbling, making it perfect for defenders, midfielders, and forwards alike.
  • Ultimate Control: A 4-degree face twist and concave shaft promote superior ball handling and control which facilitates improved hand speed.

Experience the cutting-edge technology and craftsmanship of the Mercian Elite CF95 - your ultimate partner on the field.

seo.description: Discover the Mercian Elite CF95 Xtreme Bend Hockey Stick, featuring a 95% carbon lay-up, advanced composite materials, and innovative design elements for superior performance and durability. Ideal for players seeking precision and power.

nodes.title: Mercian Elite CF95 Pro Bend Hockey Stick - Elite Composite Technology
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Mercian Elite CF95 Pro Bend Hockey Stick - Elite Composite Technology

Unlock your potential with the Mercian Elite CF95 Hockey Stick, a premium choice for aspiring intermediate players and elite athletes. Crafted with a 95% carbon lay-up and a fibreglass micro-skeleton, this stick provides exceptional touch and feel, surpassing the CK95 model. The Pro Bend design features an optimised shape and balance point for enhanced control and hitting power. Nano polymer resin creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.

The CF95 is suitable for:

  • Defensive Players who enjoy push passing and slapping. The head weighting aids hitting and passing as well as tight control.
  • Midfield Players who enjoy running with the ball but are not focused on lifting the ball off the ground (ultimate bend for this), but enjoy passing, whether it be a push pass, a slap or a hit.
  • Forward Players who like to focus on accurate control, powerful hit and slap shots, and running with the ball with controlled movement.

Key Features:

  • 95% Carbon Construction: Superior stiffness and energy transfer for powerful strikes.
  • Pro Bend Design: Optimised shape and balance point enhance control and hitting power. 23.5mm bend at 230mm from the head.
  • Advanced Vibration Control: Dual-process dampening with piezo-electric fibres and M-Gel for reduced vibration.
  • Durable Materials: Nano-polymer resin and Tungsten Carbide diffused Kevlar (TCDK) technology ensure longevity and performance.

Experience the cutting-edge technology and craftsmanship of the Mercian Elite CF95 - your ultimate partner on the field.

seo.description: Discover the Mercian Elite CF95 Pro Bend Hockey Stick, featuring a 95% carbon lay-up, advanced composite materials, and innovative design elements for superior performance and durability. Ideal for players seeking precision and power.

nodes.title: Mercian CKF90 Ultimate V2 Bend Hockey Stick - Elite Composite Technology
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Mercian Elite CKF90 Ultimate V2 Bend Hockey Stick - Elite Composite Technology Stick

Experience top-tier performance with the Mercian Elite CKF90 Hockey Stick. Designed for advanced and aspiring intermediate players, this stick features a 90% carbon construction with a fibreglass micro-skeleton for exceptional touch and durability. The Ultimate V2 Bend, new for 2025, features an aggressive low bow for enhanced drag flicking, aerial skills, and 3D dribbling. It has a thinner toe and sculpted head for better ball control and lifting. Nano polymer resin creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.

Key Features:

  • High-Quality Carbon: Preferred carbon from Japan, Germany, Scotland, and South Africa provides stiffness but can be brittle. Combining carbon with fibreglass and Kevlar enhances strength and durability.
  • Fibreglass Construction: Fine glass fibres combined into thicker fibres, dipped in resin, and laid out to create single directional sheets. These sheets are layered at different angles for multi-directional strength.
  • High Friction Finish: The final layer of lacquer on the face of the stick is mixed with fine grains of silicon polymer to create a texture that stops the ball spinning on contact. These tiny rubber particles 'squash' on ball impact, providing a damping effect.
  • Ultimate V2 Bend: 24.5mm bend at 200mm from the head.
  • Dual-Process Vibration Control: Piezo-electric fibres convert vibrations into heat for efficient dampening.
  • Kevlar (Aramid) Durability: Enhances the strength and durability of the stick.
  • Fibreglass Micro-Skeleton and Laminates: Forms a flexible base that absorbs energy, combined with carbon, Kevlar, and basalt for enhanced performance.
  • Nano-Polymer Resin: Creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.
  • Tungsten Carbide Diffused Kevlar: Enhances strength and durability by diffusing tungsten carbide through Kevlar.

seo.description: Discover the Mercian CKF90 Ultimate V2 Bend Hockey Stick, featuring a 90% carbon lay-up, advanced composite materials, and innovative design elements for superior performance and durability. Ideal for players seeking precision and power.

Nano polymer resin creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.

Key Features:

  • High-Quality Carbon: Preferred carbon from Japan, Germany, Scotland, and South Africa provides stiffness but can be brittle. Combining carbon with fibreglass and Kevlar enhances strength and durability.
  • Fibreglass Construction: Fine glass fibres combined into thicker fibres, dipped in resin, and laid out to create single directional sheets. These sheets are layered at different angles for multi-directional strength.
  • High Friction Finish: The final layer of lacquer on the face of the stick is mixed with fine grains of silicon polymer to create a texture that stops the ball spinning on contact. These tiny rubber particles 'squash' on ball impact, providing a damping effect.
  • Pro Bend: 23.5mm bend at 230mm from the head.
  • Dual-Process Vibration Control: Piezo-electric fibres convert vibrations into heat for efficient dampening.
  • Kevlar (Aramid) Durability: Enhances the strength and durability of the stick.
  • Fibreglass Micro-Skeleton and Laminates: Forms a flexible base that absorbs energy, combined with carbon, Kevlar, and basalt for enhanced performance.
  • Nano-Polymer Resin: Creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.
  • Tungsten Carbide Diffused Kevlar: Enhances strength and durability by diffusing tungsten carbide through Kevlar.

nodes.title: Mercian Evolution CKF75 Ultimate V2 Bend Hockey Stick - Advanced Composite Stick
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Mercian Evolution CKF75 Ultimate V2 Bend Hockey Stick - Advanced Composite Stick

The Mercian Evolution CKF75 Ultimate V2 Bend is a 75% carbon model with high-quality Toray carbon placed across a 15% fibreglass skeleton for strength in all directions. The 10% Kevlar increases durability, stiffness, and laminate bonding. This model features an aggressive Ultimate (extreme) low bow (24.5mm @ 200mm) for enhanced drag flicking, aerial skills, and 3D dribbling. Nano polymer resin creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.

Key Features:

  • High-Quality Carbon: Preferred carbon from Japan, Germany, Scotland, and South Africa provides stiffness but can be brittle. Combining carbon with fibreglass and Kevlar enhances strength and durability.
  • Fibreglass Construction: Fine glass fibres combined into thicker fibres, dipped in resin, and laid out to create single directional sheets. These sheets are layered at different angles for multi-directional strength.
  • High Friction Finish: The final layer of lacquer on the face of the stick is mixed with fine grains of silicon polymer to create a texture that stops the ball spinning on contact. These tiny rubber particles 'squash' on ball impact, providing a damping effect.
  • Ultimate (Extreme) Low Bend: 24.5mm bend at 200mm from the head for enhanced drag flicking, aerial skills, and 3D dribbling.
  • M-Gel Vibration Control: Silicon gel injected into the handle absorbs vibrations caused by power skills such as hitting and slapping, providing much more feel.
  • Kevlar (Aramid) Durability: Enhances the strength and durability of the stick.
  • Fibreglass Micro-Skeleton and Laminates: Forms a flexible base that absorbs energy, combined with carbon, Kevlar, and basalt for enhanced performance.
  • Dual-Process Vibration Control: Piezo-electric fibres convert vibrations into heat for efficient dampening.
  • Cold Touch Lacquer: Provides a cool feel to the stick's surface.

nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Mercian Evolution CKF65 Pro Bend Hockey Stick - Advanced Composite Stick

The Mercian Evolution CKF65 is a 65% carbon model with high-quality Toray carbon placed in multi-direction laminate sheets for strength in all directions. The 25% fibreglass skeleton and integrated fibreglass laminates provide great touch and feel, while the 10% Kevlar increases durability, stiffness, and laminate bonding. This model is available in the Pro (low) bend (23.5mm @ 230mm), suitable for multiple skill sets and abilities. Nano polymer resin creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.

Key Features:

  • High-Quality Carbon: Preferred carbon from Japan, Germany, Scotland, and South Africa provides stiffness but can be brittle. Combining carbon with fibreglass and Kevlar enhances strength and durability.
  • Fibreglass Construction: Fine glass fibres combined into thicker fibres, dipped in resin, and laid out to create single directional sheets. These sheets are layered at different angles for multi-directional strength.
  • High Friction Finish: The final layer of lacquer on the face of the stick is mixed with fine grains of silicon polymer to create a texture that stops the ball spinning on contact. These tiny rubber particles 'squash' on ball impact, providing a damping effect.
  • Pro (Low) Bend: 24mm bend at 230mm from the head.
  • M-Gel Vibration Control: Silicon gel injected into the handle absorbs vibrations caused by power skills such as hitting and slapping, providing much more feel.
  • Kevlar (Aramid) Durability: Enhances the strength and durability of the stick.
  • Fibreglass Micro-Skeleton and Laminates: Forms a flexible base that absorbs energy, combined with carbon, Kevlar, and basalt for enhanced performance.
  • Dual-Process Vibration Control: Piezo-electric fibres convert vibrations into heat for efficient dampening.
  • Cold Touch Lacquer: Provides a cool feel to the stick's surface.

nodes.title: Mercian Evolution CKF55 Xtreme Bend Hockey Stick - Advanced Composite Stick
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Advanced Performance and Durability

The Mercian Extreme bend combines popular features with new elements, including a thinned toe for 3D skills, flattened backhand zone for accuracy, 24.5mm bend, 2mm concave shaft, 4-degree face twist, and thinned handle. Available on CKF55, CKF85, and CF95 models.

The nano polymer resin creates a more flexible but stronger bond between the composite layers, increasing the stiffness of the sticks and reducing the risk of de-lamination.

Kevlar, a high-strength para-aramid synthetic fibre, is used in various applications including bulletproof vests due to its tensile strength. Tungsten carbide, a compound of tungsten and carbon, is twice as strong as steel. TCDK diffuses tungsten carbide through Kevlar, enhancing strength and durability.

The amount of carbon in a hockey stick is often questioned, but quality matters more than quantity. High-quality carbon from Japan, Germany, Scotland, and South Africa is preferred. Carbon fibers provide stiffness but can be brittle. Combining carbon with materials like fibreglass and Kevlar enhances strength and durability.

Fibreglass in hockey sticks is strong, less brittle than carbon, and forms a flexible, energy-absorbing base. Layered at different angles for multi-directional strength, it enhances performance when combined with carbon, Kevlar, and basalt. Mercian prefers a non-carbon base skeleton.

The final layer of lacquer on the face of the stick is mixed with fine grains of silicon polymer to create a texture which stops the balls spinning on contact. These tiny rubber particles 'squash' on ball impact providing a damping effect.

Piezo-electric fibres in Evolution sticks convert vibrations into heat, providing efficient vibration dampening. Active molecules in the material bend under force, emitting a small electric charge dispelled as heat. This technology, originally used in tennis, enhances stick performance.

The Evolution CKF55 is a 55% carbon model with the high-quality Toray carbon placed in multi-direction laminate sheets (creates strength in all directions) across a (30%) fibreglass skeleton and with integrated fibreglass laminates giving great touch and feel with the (15%) Kevlar increasing durability, stiffness and laminate bonding. This model is available in the Pro (low) bend (24mm @ 230mm), suitable for multiple skill sets and abilities.

Key Features:

  • 55% Carbon
  • Xtreme (low) bend (24.5mm @ 200mm)
  • Dual-process vibration control (Piezo-Electric fibres, M-Gel)
  • Nano-Polymer Resin
  • High Friction Face
  • Cold Touch Lacquer
  • White face model to disguise ball carrying position and release point when drag-flicking

Mercian Evolution CKF35 Hockey Stick - Intermediate Composite Stick

The Mercian Evolution CKF35 is a 35% carbon pro-bend composite hockey stick, designed for junior players who want to deliver more power with their hit and slap skills. The 35% carbon provides stiffness, while the fibreglass offers touch, feel, and durability. The lightweight construction and higher balance point make skill execution easier for juniors, while the full-size head enhances hitting and slapping power. Nano polymer resin creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.

  • High Friction Finish: The final layer of lacquer on the face of the stick is mixed with fine grains of silicon polymer to create a texture that stops the ball spinning on contact. These tiny rubber particles 'squash' on ball impact, providing a damping effect.
  • Pro Bend: 23.5mm bend at 230mm from the head for enhanced stick turnover and hitting power.
  • M-Gel Vibration Control: Silicon gel injected into the handle absorbs vibrations caused by power skills such as hitting and slapping, providing much more feel.
  • Kevlar (Aramid) Durability: Enhances the strength and durability of the stick.

nodes.title: Mercian Indoor Evolution Pro Wood
nodes.descriptionHtml:
The only wooden indoor stick in the Evolution range, combining carbon, Kevlar and fibreglass reinforcement over a wooden core. The Evolution Wood has a low bend to aid dragflicking and powerful push passing, but the most important feature is the enhanced touch and feel that the solid wooden core offers. Wooden hockey sticks are favoured by the top players in the leading indoor playing nations such as Germany, Poland and Austria..

  • 100% Wooden Core with fibreglass, carbon and Kevlar reinforcement
  • Low Bend - approx 24mm, position varies because of hand made craftsmanship

Mercian Evolution 0.9

75% Carbon construction hockey stickDSH bends, the 25% alternative composite make-up offering touch and feel as well as pure power.

The Evolution 0.9 offers a 75% carbon stick in the innovative DSH for the intermediate player learning drag flicking and 3D skills, potentially transitioning from a junior or low carbon model. The Fibreglass, Kevlar and basalt base layers offer durability because of the resin impregnated composite mat reducing the brittleness associated with pure carbon, both from stick / ground â€šÃ„Ã²wearâ€šÃ„Ã´ and edge impacts (backhand). Both sticks include the high-friction resin face and m-gel vibration control.

DSH Bend

Available on the Evolution 0.3 and 0.9 models, the concave face shape â€šÃ„Ã²cupsâ€šÃ„Ã´ the ball to help with close control, 3D skill execution and lifted passes. Within the FIH 4mm deviation guidelines, the DSH face was new for 2017 / 2018 collection and continues in the 2018 / 2019 range

nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Genesis CF15 Hockey Stick - Entry Level Composite Stick

The Genesis CF15 is a 15% carbon entry-level composite stick with specifically placed carbon inserts for good levels of stiffness, durability, and strength in specific areas. The underlying fibreglass lay-up and advanced resins enhance durability despite the lightweight pick-up, aiding skill execution. Nano polymer resin creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.

Key Features:

  • High-Quality Carbon: Preferred carbon from Japan, Germany, Scotland, and South Africa provides stiffness but can be brittle. Combining carbon with fibreglass and Kevlar enhances strength and durability.
  • Fibreglass Construction: Fine glass fibres combined into thicker fibres, dipped in resin, and laid out to create single directional sheets. These sheets are layered at different angles for multi-directional strength.
  • High Friction Finish: The final layer of lacquer on the face of the stick is mixed with fine grains of silicon polymer to create a texture that stops the ball spinning on contact. These tiny rubber particles 'squash' on ball impact, providing a damping effect.
  • Pro (Low) Bend: 23.5mm bend at 230mm from the head.
  • M-Gel Vibration Control: Silicon gel injected into the handle absorbs vibrations caused by power skills such as hitting and slapping, providing much more feel.
  • Fibreglass Micro-Skeleton and Laminates: Forms a flexible base that absorbs energy, combined with carbon, Kevlar, and basalt for enhanced performance.

The Genesis CF5 is designed to meet the needs of young field hockey players transitioning to their first composite stick. nodes.title: Mercian Elite CKF90 Pro Bend GK Stick - Elite Composite Technology
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Mercian CKF90 Pro Bend Goalkeeping Field Hockey Stick - Elite Composite Technology

Maximise your Game with 90% Carbon Construction

Elevate your performance on the field with the Mercian CKF90 Pro Bend stick, crafted from 90% high-quality carbon for superior energy transfer and power. This stick features an innovative design with a modified balance point, enhancing head speed while ensuring durability through the added 5% Kevlar. Perfect for rigorous training sessions, it withstands repetitive save practice and excels in deflection clearances.

Key Features:

  • Pro Bend Technology: The 23.5mm bow, positioned just below the midpoint, facilitates effortless stick turnover and maximises power. The thicker head (1.5mm) enhances this performance wherever the ball may strike.
  • Durability Meets Performance: Our unique composite micro-skeleton combines carbon with Kevlar and fibreglass, creating a resilient structure that absorbs vibrations and enhances gameplay.
  • Enhanced Grip: The Cold Satin Lacquer finish not only looks great but also provides improved feel and control.
  • Nano Polymer Resin: Creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.
  • Kevlar (Aramid) Durability: Enhances strength and durability by diffusing tungsten carbide through Kevlar.
  • High-Quality Carbon: Preferred carbon from Japan, Germany, Scotland, and South Africa provides stiffness but can be brittle. Combining carbon with fibreglass and Kevlar enhances strength and durability.
  • High Friction Finish: The final layer of lacquer on the face of the stick is mixed with fine grains of silicon polymer to create a texture that stops the ball spinning on contact. These tiny rubber particles 'squash' on ball impact, providing a damping effect.
  • Piezo-Electric Vibration Control: Piezo-electric fibres convert vibrations into heat for efficient dampening.

Unlock Your Full Potential with the Mercian CKF90 Pro Bend Stick. Achieve new heights in your game with a stick designed for power, precision, and durability. Get yours today and experience the difference!

The Elite CKF90 39" Reach stick is specifically designed for shoot-outs. With a unique kinked shaft and head shape, this stick maximises vertical saving area while preventing the ball from slipping underneath

nodes.title: Evolution GK DM Mid Bend Hockey Stick - Advanced Composite Stick
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Mercian Evolution GK DM Mid Bend Hockey Stick - Advanced Composite Stick

Designed by New Zealand international keeper Devon Manchester, this GK stick features an 80% carbon shell for exceptional stiffness and powerful saves. The full-size field stick shaft ensures high levels of composite strength for multiple saves and clearances. The full hook indoor profile head maximizes saving area and facilitates speedy movements. The balance point is adjusted to remove weight from the head and place it mid-shaft to ease speed of movement but maximize strength.

Key Features:

  • Mid Bend (23mm / 275mm): Offers a smoother bend to the shaft, useful for a more upright hitting position and "power" skills.
  • Nano Polymer Resin: Creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.
  • Kevlar (Aramid) Durability: Enhances strength and durability by diffusing tungsten carbide through Kevlar.
  • High-Quality Carbon: Preferred carbon from Japan, Germany, Scotland, and South Africa provides stiffness but can be brittle. Combining carbon with fibreglass and Kevlar enhances strength and durability.
  • High Friction Finish: The final layer of lacquer on the face of the stick is mixed with fine grains of silicon polymer to create a texture that stops the ball spinning on contact. These tiny rubber particles 'squash' on ball impact, providing a damping effect.
  • Piezo-Electric Vibration Control: Piezo-electric fibres convert vibrations into heat for efficient dampening.

Featuring an 80% carbon shell for exceptional stiffness, full-size field stick shaft for composite strength, and a full hook indoor profile head for maximum saving area and speedy movements. Ideal for powerful saves and clearances.

nodes.title: Mercian Genesis CF25 Goalkeeping Stick - Intermediate Composite Stick
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Genesis CF25 Goalkeeping Stick - Intermediate Composite Stick

An intermediate GK stick utilising the strength of a 25% carbon shell and a standard low bow shape. A slightly higher balance point (moving towards the handle from the head) assists stick head movement and therefore increases saving potential. The stiffness provided enables balls to be confidently deflected and swept away. Available in 34" and 36.5".

The 25% carbon delivers the required stiffness, while the fibreglass provides touch, feel, and durability. The lightweight construction and higher balance point make skill execution easier for juniors. Nano polymer resin creates a flexible but stronger bond between composite layers, increasing stiffness and reducing the risk of de-lamination.

Key Features:

  • High-Quality Carbon: Preferred carbon from Japan, Germany, Scotland, and South Africa provides stiffness but can be brittle. Combining carbon with fibreglass and Kevlar enhances strength and durability.
  • Fibreglass Construction: Fine glass fibres combined into thicker fibres, dipped in resin, and laid out to create single directional sheets. These sheets are layered at different angles for multi-directional strength.
  • High Friction Finish: The final layer of lacquer on the face of the stick is mixed with fine grains of silicon polymer to create a texture that stops the ball spinning on contact. These tiny rubber particles 'squash' on ball impact, providing a damping effect.
  • Pro (Low) Bend: 24mm bend at 230mm from the head.
  • M-Gel Vibration Control: Silicon gel injected into the handle absorbs vibrations caused by power skills such as hitting and slapping, providing much more feel.
  • Fibreglass Micro-Skeleton and Laminates: Forms a flexible base that absorbs energy, combined with carbon, Kevlar, and basalt for enhanced performance.

nodes.title: Elite CK95 Ultimate (2024/25)
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Mercian Elite CK95 Field Hockey Stick - 95% Carbon, Ultimate Low Bend for Advanced Players

Unleash your potential with the Mercian Elite CK95 Hockey Stick, the pinnacle of performance in our range. Crafted with a 95% carbon lay-up over a Kevlar skeleton, this stick features a quad-carbon sleeve to maximise energy transfer and power. The Ultimate (Extreme) Low Bend (24.5mm @ 200mm) is suitable for:

  • Defensive Players who enjoy running with the ball, eliminating opponents, especially with 3D skills, playing overhead passes and disguised slaps
  • Midfield Players who enjoy dribbling, taking advantage of the tilted head, executing 3D skills and playing 'pop' passes with various degrees of lift
  • Forward Players who like to eliminate defenders using a variety of quick hands and lifts, fire powerful shots at goal with an easy ability to lift the ball and carry the ball at speed because of the higher balance point and lighter pick up

Key Features:

  • 95% Carbon Construction. Superior stiffness and energy transfer for powerful strikes
  • Quad-Carbon Sleeve. Provides 360 degree strength, a softer feel, and enhanced power
  • Ultimate Low Bend.Â¬â€ Perfect for drag-flicking and executing advanced skills
  • Advanced Vibration Control. Dual process dampening with piezo-electric fibres and M-Gel for reduced vibration
  • Durable Materials. Nano-Polymer resin and Tungsten Carbide diffused Kevlar (TCDK) technology ensure longevity and performance

Whether you're an aspiring intermediate or elite athlete, the Elite CK95 is tailored for players who excel in defensive, midfield, or forward positions. Elevate your game with this high-performance stick!

The highest specification stick in the Mercian range, combining a 95% carbon lay-up over a Kevlar skeleton, The Elite CK95 features a quad-carbon sleeve to maximise energy transfer and power and combines it with an Ultimate (extreme) low bend to aid drag-flicking, aerials and 3D skills.

  • 95% Carbon
  • Quad-Carbon Sleeve
  • Ultimate X-Low Bend (24.5mm @ 200mm)
  • 3 process vibration control (Piezo-Electric fibres, M-Gel, EVA under grip)
  • Nano-Polymer Resin
  • Full technical details on the 'technical details' tab
  • Player suitability on the 'player profile' tab
","position":0,"chosen":false,"selected":false},{"title":"Technical Details","content":"

ULTIMATE BEND

The Mercian Ultimate Bend is the most aggressive low bow that we have ever made, with the bend of the stick effectively cupping the ball. The maximum bend at this lowest legal point enhances drag ï¬‚icking and aerial skills with the balance point of the stick adjusted to also favour 3D dribbling skills. Whilst the shaft weighting aid sticks head speed it still provides power and balance for the slapping and pushing associated with elite level skill execution.

 

CARBON FIBRE: CK95 â€“ 95% CARBON

One of the most common questions asked by the consumer is â€˜how much carbon?â€™ with the perception that more is better. That is far from the truth, so to shed a little light. Firstly, the quality of carbon (manufacturing point) is important. Toray (Japanese) Carbon is often considered the best, but Carbon from Germany, Scotland and South Africa (to name a few) are all high-quality. Sticks are usually made in Pakistan and most major brands will import Carbon into Pakistan to make sticks. Local made carbon is not usually as good. But it is difficult to know if a brand uses imported carbon. The number of filaments in the carbon fibre is relevant, 1K, 3K etc relate to the number of filaments of pure carbon within a fibre or â€˜towâ€™. 1K is used in aeronautical industry and electronics. 3K and 6K are commonly used in sport as they have the right combination of weight and strength. Anything over 6K is very dense and too heavy for sports equipment. Again, this isnâ€™t a common line of questioning from the consumer but may come up. Carbon fibres are a straight-line material and provide stiffness in a single direction. To provide stiffness in multiple directions the fibre can be woven into a multi-directional sheet (seen as an obvious weave in the sticks surface) or single direction sheets can be layered over each other to create the multi-directional stiffness. 40% of the weight of a composite stick comes from the resin within it. So, a stick canâ€™t be 100% carbon. However, it can be claimed that 100% of the composite materials in a stick are carbon. Mercian do not believe this gives optimal strength and so always combine the carbon overlay with a composite micro-skeleton made from fibreglass, Kevlar (aramid) and basalt. Carbon is stiff but brittle. The stiffness means that the energy created by the player when striking the ball â€“ hit / slap â€“ transfers to the ball and is not absorbed by the stick. Maximum energy transfer allowed by the FIH is 98%. But this stiffness means that the stick will not absorb energy on trapping / receiving so needs soft hands! The brittleness of carbon means that if the fibres are broken (stick tackle / post impact) they will crack, and the stick can or will fail. This is not a manufacturing fault. Other materials can be used in conjunction with carbon to get a positive performance outcome. Special chemicals are used with paints and lacquers to get them to bend to the top layer of carbon and create high-quality graphics. 

 

QUAD CARBON SLEEVE â€“ Q.C.S  

Mercianâ€™s QCS technology is based around enhancing the already common braided technology. Braiding as a dictionary definition means: â€˜to interweave several strands of (hair, thread, etc); to plaitâ€™ By weaving carbon strands together you create a carbon sleeve, this provides 360-degree, seamless strength within a stick. Using such a full-length sleeve creates a softer feel, a lighter weight, but creates exceptional energy transfer and therefore power. Mercian then overlay the full-length sleeve with 3 more smaller sleeves to offer enhanced protection at the three identified stress points â€“ base of handle, backhand hitting zone and stick â€˜heelâ€™. By utilising these four sleeves we create a unique structure for delivery of maximum power and durability. 

 

TCDK (tungsten carbide diffused Kevlar) â€“ CK95 â€“ 5% KEVLAR

Kevlar is the registered trademark for a para-aramid synthetic fibre, also known simply as ARAMID in other sticks. This high-strength material was first commercially used in the early 1970s as a replacement for steel in racing tires. Typically, it is spun into ropes or fabric sheets that can be used as such or as an ingredient in composite material components. Currently, Kevlar has many applications, including bulletproof vests, because of its high tensile strength-to-weight ratio; by this measure it is 5 times stronger than steel. Tungsten carbide (chemical formula WC) is a chemical compound (specifically, a carbide) containing equal parts of tungsten and carbon atoms. In its most basic form, tungsten carbide is a fine grey powder, Tungsten carbide is approximately twice as strong as steel, For TCDK the fine powder version of WC is diffused through a sheet of Kevlar in the manufacturing process further enhancing the natural characteristics of the material and increasing both its strength and more specifically its durability. 

 

PEIZO-ELECTRIC FIBRES 

Piezo-electric fibres are included in all the Evolution sticks they are used to â€˜harvestâ€™ the vibrations created in these super-stiff sticks and turn them into heat. The result of this is efficient vibration dampening. It's achieved because the molecules within the material are active, the force applied to them (vibrations) causes the fibres to bend and emit a small electric charge that is dispelled as heat. The technology originally used by Head in tennis, applied those forces through an electrode to counter-act the vibrations (this isnâ€™t present in hockey sticks!)

 

NANO-POLYMER RESIN 

The particles within our resins have been altered at a nano-size level (10 x below microscopic) Instead of using nano-carbon particles, the use of rubberized polymers creates a more flexible but stronger bond between the composite layers. This increases the stiffness of the sticks and reduces de-lamination.

nodes.title: Mercian Evolution 0.3 Ultimate 2018
nodes.descriptionHtml:
PRODUCT DETAILS

Mercian Evolution 0.3

A 95% carbon lay-up hockey stick with Quad Carbon Sleeve overlay and a fibreglass micro-skeleton. Available in Ultimate and HEX bend only. A four-piece carbon sleeve placed over a 95% carbon lay-up creates an exceptionally stiff high-performance stick. The Ultimate bend is more suited to drag flicking and 3D skills then the pro-bend, and so is a favourite with penalty corner specialists. The HEX bend is a hexagonal handle giving unique positioning feel for the palm of the hand and fingertips. The handle flattens into the shaft giving enhanced stiffness because of the clear spine and also an identifiable backhand area. The QCS technology replicates the power delivered with conventional â€šÃ„Ã²braidingâ€šÃ„Ã´ but can be modified to enhance protection at specific stress points. All the evolution sticks also incorporate a textured resin face for ball control and two vibration control technologies â€šÃ„Ã¬ piezo-electric fibres and an m-gel internal collar. An additional feature is the extra cushioned grip created with a 0.75mm PU foam layer beneath the standard super-soft m-tek grip.

nodes.title: Mercian Evolution 0.4 DSH 2018
nodes.descriptionHtml:
PRODUCT DETAILS

Mercian Evolution 0.4

A 90% carbon hockey stick for high levels of energy transfer and striking power.

Available in DSH bend.The DSH is a 2mm concave face specifically designed to work with a 24mm bend to enhance drag-flicking and 3D skills. The â€šÃ„Ã²cupâ€šÃ„Ã´ aids ball pull back from the left side of the body and enhances elimination skills. The new DSH mould has a fatter shaft profile to increase the cross-sectional area and aid hitting power. An internal silicon rubber sleeve (m-gel) protects the user from some of the vibrations associated with the stiffest sticks. An additional feature is the extra cushioned grip created with a 0.75mm PU foam layer beneath the standard super-soft m-tek grip.

DSH Bend

Available on the Evolution 0.3 and 0.9 models, the concave face shape â€šÃ„Ã²cupsâ€šÃ„Ã´ the ball to help with close control, 3D skill execution and lifted passes. Within the FIH 4mm deviation guidelines, the DSH face was new for 2017 / 2018 collection and continues in the 2018 / 2019 range

nodes.title: Mercian Evolution 0.6 Green HEX 2018
nodes.descriptionHtml:
PRODUCT DETAILS

Mercian Evolution 0.6

85% Carbon construction hockey stick with multiple material composite base layers for durability, torsional strength and â€šÃ„Ã²feelâ€šÃ„Ã´.

The Evolution 0.6 is available in Pro Bend to aid regular skill execution and HEX bend. The flatter face profile of the PRO (compared to the Ultimate and DSH) aids pure hitting and slapping skills, both in terms of accuracy and the tendency to lift the ball. The 85% carbon construction creates a stick that easily transfers a high percentage of a playerâ€šÃ„Ã´s energy to the ball, offering high ball speeds on slaps and hits. The HEX bend is a hexagonal handle giving unique positioning feel for the palm of the hand and fingertips. The handle flattens into the shaft giving enhanced stiffness because of the clear spine and also an identifiable backhand area. Â¬â€ The 15% of â€šÃ„Ã²otherâ€šÃ„Ã´ composite materials ensures a good level of vibration control and offers a softness that helps ball control and connects the players to the ball for a higher level of skill execution than just a power focussed product.

nodes.title: Mercian Evolution 0.7 Mint Ultimate 2018
nodes.descriptionHtml:
PRODUCT DETAILS

Mercian Evolution 0.7

Multi-layer carbon construction hockey stick with 80% Toray carbon supplemented with fibreglass, Kevlar and basalt.

This Ultimate bend stick represents fantastic value for money with 80% Carbon at a relatively low consumer price point. The Ultimate bend offers an aggressive low-bend shape with an open face and shaft profile to aid drag-flicking, sling-shot pushing and disguised slaps. The high-levels of carbon still offer high energy transfer which is the fundamental requirement for hitting power, however, the 20% make-up of fibreglass, basalt and Kevlar offer a good level of feel and forgiveness if the player doesnâ€šÃ„Ã´t find the hitting sweet sport every time.

nodes.title: Mercian Evolution 0.8 Pro 2018
nodes.descriptionHtml:
PRODUCT DETAILS

Mercian Evolution 0.8

80% Carbon pro-bend hockey stick with 20% Fibreglass skeleton for enhanced touch and feel.

The high friction resin face of the Evo 0.8 works with the 20% fibreglass skeleton to aid touch and feel required for consistent execution of ball receiving skills. The energy transfer associated with the 80% carbon lay-up still offers exceptional hitting power but the additional materials used in construction, combined with the Pro bend create a stick suited for the aspiring performance player as they transition from intermediate to elite level.

nodes.title: Mercian Elite CK95 Ultimate
nodes.descriptionHtml:
The highest specification stick in the Mercian range, combining a 95% carbon lay-up over a Kevlar skeleton, The Elite CK95 features a quad-carbon sleeve to maximise energy transfer and power and combines it with a Ultimate (extreme) low bend to aid drag-flicking, aerials and 3D skills.

  • 95% Carbon
  • Quad-Carbon Sleeve
  • Ultimate (Extreme) Low Bend (24.5mm @ 200mm)
  • 3 process vibration control (Piezo-Electric fibres, M-Gel, EVA under grip)
  • Nano-Polymer Resin
  • Full technical details on the 'technical details' tab
  • Player suitability on the 'player profile' tab

CARBON FIBRE 

One of the most common questions asked by the consumer is â€˜how much carbon?â€™ with the perception that more is better. That is far from the truth, so to shed a little light. Firstly the quality of carbon (manufacturing point) is important. Toray (Japanese) Carbon is often considered the best, but Carbon from Germany, Scotland and South Africa (to name a few) are all high-quality. Sticks are usually made in Pakistan and most major brands will import Carbon into Pakistan to make sticks. Local made carbon is not usually as good. But it is difficult to know if a brand uses imported carbon. The number of filaments in the carbon fibre is relevant, 1K, 3K etc relate to the number of filaments of pure carbon within a fibre or â€˜towâ€™. 1K is used in aeronautical industry and electronics. 3K and 6K are commonly used in sport as they have the right combination of weight and strength. Anything over 6K is very dense and too heavy for sports equipment. To provide stiffness in multiple directions the fibre can be woven into a multi-directional sheet (seen as an obvious weave in the sticks surface) or single direction sheets can be layered over each other to create the multi-directional stiffness. 40% of the weight of a composite stick comes from the resin within it. So a stick canâ€™t be 100% carbon. However it can be claimed that 100% of the composite materials in a stick are carbon. Mercian do not believe this gives optimal strength and so always combine the carbon overlay with a composite micro-skeleton made from fibreglass, Kevlar (aramid) and basalt. Carbon is stiff but brittle. The stiffness means that the energy created by the player when striking the ball â€“ hit / slap â€“ transfers to the ball and is not absorbed by the stick. Maximum energy transfer allowed by the FIH is 98%. But this stiffness means that the stick will not absorb energy on trapping / receiving so needs soft hands! The brittleness of carbon means that if the fibres are broken (stick tackle / post impact) they will crack and the stick can or will fail. This is not a manufacturing fault. Other materials can be used in conjunction with carbon to get a positive performance outcome. Special chemicals are used with paints and lacquers to get them to bend to the top layer of carbon and create high-quality graphics. 

 

QUAD CARBON SLEEVE â€“ Q.C.S  

Mercianâ€™s QCS technology is based around enhancing the already common braided technology. Braiding as a dictionary definition means: â€˜to interweave several strands of (hair, thread,etc); to plaitâ€™ By weaving carbon strands together you create a carbon sleeve, this provides 360 degree, seamless strength within a stick. Using such a full-length sleeve creates a softer feel, a lighter weight, but creates exceptional energy transfer and therefore power. Mercian then overlay the full-length sleeve with 3 more smaller sleeves to offer enhanced protection at the three identified stress points â€“ base of handle, backhand hitting zone and stick â€˜heelâ€™. By utilising these four sleeves we create a unique structure for delivery of maximum power and durability. 

 

TCDK (tungsten carbide diffused Kevlar) 

Kevlar is the registered trademark for a para-aramid synthetic fibre, also known simply as ARAMID in other sticks. This high-strength material was first commercially used in the early 1970s as a replacement for steel in racing tires. Typically it is spun into ropes or fabric sheets that can be used as such or as an ingredient in composite material components.Currently, Kevlar has many applications, including bulletproof vests, because of its high tensile strength-to-weight ratio; by this measure it is 5 times stronger than steel. Tungsten carbide (chemical formula WC) is a chemical compound (specifically, a carbide) containing equal parts of tungsten and carbon atoms. In its most basic form, tungsten carbide is a fine grey powder, Tungsten carbide is approximately twice as strong as steel, For TCDK the fine powder version of WC is diffused through a sheet of Kevlar in the manufacturing process further enhancing the natural characteristics of the material and increasing both its strength and more specifically its durability. 

 

PEIZO-ELECTRIC FIBRES 

Piezo-electric fibres are included in all the Evolution sticks they are used to â€˜harvestâ€™ the vibrations created in these super-stiff sticks and turn them into heat. The result of this is efficient vibration dampening. Its achieved because the molecules within the material are active, the force applied to them (vibrations) causes the fibres to bend and emit a small electric charge that is dispelled as heat. The technology originally used by Head in tennis, applied those forces through an electrode to counter-act the vibrations (this isnâ€™t present in hockey sticks!)

 

NANO-POLYMER RESIN 

The particles within our resins have been altered at a nano-size level (10 x below microscopic) Instead of using nano-carbon particles, the use of rubberized polymers creates a more flexible but stronger bond between the composite layers. This increases the stiffness of the sticks and reduces de-lamination. 

 

ULTIMATE BEND

The Mercian Ultimate Bend is the most aggressive low bow that we have ever made, with the bend of the stick effectively cupping the ball. The maximum bend at this lowest legal point enhances drag ï¬‚icking and aerial skills with the balance point of the stick adjusted to also favour 3D dribbling skills. Whilst the shaft weighting aid sticks head speed it still provides power and balance for the slapping and pushing associated with elite level skill execution.

nodes.title: Elite CF95 Pro (2023)
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Mercian Elite CF95 Field Hockey Stick - 95% Carbon Pro Bend

Unlock your potential with the Mercian Elite CF95 Hockey Stick, a premium choice for aspiring intermediate players and elite athletes. Crafted with a 95% carbon lay-up and a fibreglass micro-skeleton, this stick provides exceptional touch and feel, surpassing the CK95 model. The CF95 is suitable for:

  • Defensive Players who enjoy push passing and slapping. The head weighting aids hitting and passing as well as tight control
  • Midfield Players who enjoy running with the ball but is not focused on lifting the ball off the ground (ultimate bend for this), but enjoys passing, whether it be a push pass, a slap or a hit
  • Forward Players who like to focus on accurate control, powerful hit and slap shots and running with the ball with controlled movement

Key Features:

  • 95% Carbon Construction. Superior stiffness and energy transfer for powerful strikes
  • Pro Bend Design. Optimised shape and balance point enhance control and hitting power
  • Advanced Vibration Control. Dual process dampening with piezo-electric fibres and M-Gel for reduced vibration
  • Durable Materials. Nano-Polymer resin and Tungsten Carbide diffused Kevlar (TCDK) technology ensure longevity and performance

Experience the cutting-edge technology and craftsmanship of the Mercian Elite CF95 - your ultimate partner on the field

","position":0,"chosen":false,"selected":false},{"title":"Technical Details","content":"

PRO BEND

The Mercian Pro Bend incorporates a near maximum 23.5mm bow positioned just below the mid-point of the shaft, approximately 250mm from the bottom of the stick. The shaft has then been shaped to give a thinner proï¬le under the right hand and a balance point that favours the head end of the stick. This gives a combination of great stick turn-over due to the shape but enhanced hitting power because of the balance point and sweet spot, the hitting power is also enhanced because the head is 1.5mm thicker than the ultimate bend.

 

CARBON FIBRE: CF95 â€“ 95% CARBON

One of the most common questions asked by the consumer is â€˜how much carbon?â€™ with the perception that more is better. That is far from the truth, so to shed a little light. Firstly the quality of carbon (manufacturing point) is important. Toray (Japanese) Carbon is often considered the best, but Carbon from Germany, Scotland and South Africa (to name a few) are all high-quality. Sticks are usually made in Pakistan and most major brands will import Carbon into Pakistan to make sticks. Local made carbon is not usually as good. But it is difficult to know if a brand uses imported carbon. The number of filaments in the carbon fibre is relevant, 1K, 3K etc relate to the number of filaments of pure carbon within a fibre or â€˜towâ€™. 1K is used in aeronautical industry and electronics. 3K and 6K are commonly used in sport as they have the right combination of weight and strength. Anything over 6K is very dense and too heavy for sports equipment. Again this isnâ€™t a common line of questioning from the consumer but may come up. Carbon fibres are a straight line material and so provide stiffness in a single direction. To provide stiffness in multiple directions the fibre can be woven into a multi-directional sheet (seen as an obvious weave in the sticks surface) or single direction sheets can be layered over each other to create the multi-directional stiffness. 40% of the weight of a composite stick comes from the resin within it. So, a stick canâ€™t be 100% carbon. However, it can be claimed that 100% of the composite materials in a stick are carbon. Mercian do not believe this gives optimal strength and so always combine the carbon overlay with a composite micro-skeleton made from fibreglass, Kevlar (aramid) and basalt. Carbon is stiff but brittle. The stiffness means that the energy created by the player when striking the ball â€“ hit / slap â€“ transfers to the ball and is not absorbed by the stick. Maximum energy transfer allowed by the FIH is 98%. But this stiffness means that the stick will not absorb energy on trapping / receiving so needs soft hands! The brittleness of carbon means that if the fibres are broken (stick tackle / post impact) they will crack, and the stick can or will fail. This is not a manufacturing fault. Other materials can be used in conjunction with carbon to get a positive performance outcome. Special chemicals are used with paints and lacquers to get them to bend to the top layer of carbon and create high-quality graphics. 

QUAD CARBON SLEEVE â€“ Q.C.S  

Mercianâ€™s QCS technology is based around enhancing the already common braided technology. Braiding as a dictionary definition means: â€˜to interweave several strands of (hair, thread,etc); to plaitâ€™ By weaving carbon strands together you create a carbon sleeve, this provides 360 degree, seamless strength within a stick. Using such a full-length sleeve creates a softer feel, a lighter weight, but creates exceptional energy transfer and therefore power. Mercian then overlay the full-length sleeve with 3 more smaller sleeves to offer enhanced protection at the three identified stress points â€“ base of handle, backhand hitting zone and stick â€˜heelâ€™. By utilising these four sleeves we create a unique structure for delivery of maximum power and durability. 

TCDK (tungsten carbide diffused Kevlar)

Kevlar is the registered trademark for a para-aramid synthetic fibre, also known simply as ARAMID in other sticks. This high-strength material was first commercially used in the early 1970s as a replacement for steel in racing tires. Typically it is spun into ropes or fabric sheets that can be used as such or as an ingredient in composite material components.Currently, Kevlar has many applications, including bulletproof vests, because of its high tensile strength-to-weight ratio; by this measure it is 5 times stronger than steel. Tungsten carbide (chemical formula WC) is a chemical compound (specifically, a carbide) containing equal parts of tungsten and carbon atoms. In its most basic form, tungsten carbide is a fine grey powder, Tungsten carbide is approximately twice as strong as steel, For TCDK the fine powder version of WC is diffused through a sheet of Kevlar in the manufacturing process further enhancing the natural characteristics of the material and increasing both its strength and more specifically its durability. 

PEIZO-ELECTRIC FIBRES 

Piezo-electric fibres are included in all the Evolution sticks they are used to â€˜harvestâ€™ the vibrations created in these super-stiff sticks and turn them into heat. The result of this is efficient vibration dampening. Its achieved because the molecules within the material are active, the force applied to them (vibrations) causes the fibres to bend and emit a small electric charge that is dispelled as heat. The technology originally used by Head in tennis, applied those forces through an electrode to counter-act the vibrations (this isnâ€™t present in hockey sticks!)

NANO-POLYMER RESIN 

The particles within our resins have been altered at a nano-size level (10 x below microscopic) Instead of using nano-carbon particles, the use of rubberized polymers creates a more flexible but stronger bond between the composite layers. This increases the stiffness of the sticks and reduces de-lamination. 

FIBREGLASS â€“ CF95 â€“ 5% FIBREGLASS

The basic synthetic material that makes the initial micro-skeleton in all Mercian composite sticks. Simple fibreglass stands, dipped in custom resins and then woven into sheets to be combined with other materials to create the combinations relative to the specific stickâ€™s performance.

","position":1,"chosen":false,"selected":false},{"title":"Player Profile","content":"
  • The Elite CF95 is a PRO BEND (24MM @ 230MM), high carbon stick. It suits aspirational intermediate players or elite athletes*.
  • The Pro Bend is a standard low bow which eases the execution of drag flicks, 3D skills and overhead passes, but is also suitable for standard slaps, hits and great close control.
  • It is suitable for a (advanced*) defensive player who enjoys push passing, hitting and slapping as primary skills. (Jab and block tackling are skill, not stick, dependant). The lower balance point gives some head weight to aid ball control.
  • It is suitable for a (advanced*) midfield player who enjoys running with the ball but is not focused on lifting the ball off the ground. The head weighting aids hitting for shooting and passing as well as tight control.
  • It is suitable for a (advanced*) forward who likes to focus on accurate control, powerful hit and slap shots and running with the ball with controlled movement.
","position":2}]}

nodes.title: Genesis 0.1 2020
nodes.descriptionHtml:
PRODUCT DESCRIPTION

NEW 25% Carbon Pro-bend composite hockey stick with M-Gel and high friction face. An intermediate composite stick for a junior player, the full carbon shell creates a good level of energy transfer for powerful skill execution. The vibration control required by younger players is created using an internal silicon rubber sleeve (M-Gel). This sleeve means that stopping and dribbling are enhanced as the player can feel the ball on their stick much better.

nodes.title: Mercian Elite CF95 Pro
nodes.descriptionHtml:
The second model in the Elite range, the 95% carbon lay-up is placed across a fibreglass micro-skeleton giving more touch and feel than the CK95. The Pro Bend is suited for a wide variety of playing styles, without the aggression of the Ultimate bend.

  • 95% Carbon
  • Pro Low Bend (24mm @ 230mm)
  • Dual process vibration control (Piezo-Electric fibres, M-Gel)
  • Nano-Polymer Resin
  • X-fibre backhand edge

nodes.title: Elite CKF90 Xtreme (White Face) (2024)
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Mercian CKF90 Xtreme Bend Hockey Stick

Elevate Your Game with the CKF90 Xtreme Bend

Introducing the 2024 Mercian CKF90 Xtreme Bend hockey stick, engineered for players who demand precision and power. With a striking white face, this model cleverly disguises the ball's carrying position and release point during drag-flicking, optimising your performance on the field.

Key Features:

  • High-Performance Composition. Crafted with a 90% premium carbon, supported by a fibreglass micro-skeleton and reinforced with Tungsten Carbide Diffused Kevlar for unparalleled durability
  • Ultimate Low Bend. Designed with an aggressive 24.5mm bend at 200mm, enhancing drag flicks, aerial skills and 3D manoeuvres
  • Innovative Vibration Control. Incorporates a 3-process vibration control system (Piezo-Electric fibres, M-Gel and an EVA under grip) for exception feel and reduced vibrations
  • Advanced Materials. Utilises Nano-Polymer Resin for improved bonding and strength, alongside lightweight fibreglass

Performance Benefits:

  • Precision Handling. The Xtreme Bend features a thinned toe for easier ball elevation, while the flat backhand zone enhances shooting accuracy
  • Enhanced Skills. Optimised for elite-level execution, this stick excels in drag flicks, slaps, and 3D dribbling, making it perfect for defenders, midfielders, and forwards alike
  • Ultimate Control. A 4-degree face twist and concave shaft promote superior ball handling and control which facilitates improved hand speed

Ideal For: Aspirational intermediate to advanced players looking to elevate their game. Whether you're a defender mastering elimination skills or a forward executing lifted shots, the CKF90 Xtreme Bend is your ultimate tool for performance

Why Choose CKF90? Experience the perfect blend of power, precision, and advanced technology. Dominate the field with the CKF90 Xtreme Bend hockey stick, and unleash your full potential

The backhand zone has been flattened to aid passing and shooting accuracy. The actual bend of the stick (face) is the same as the Ultimate â€“ 24.5mm at a maximum bend point of 200mm from the head. A 2mm concave shaft, with the concave situated above the stick face, so enhancing flicking and â€˜sling-shotâ€™ slapping skills but without compromising the ball / face impact. 4-degree face twist to aid ball handling, dribbling and control on the reverse side.   • The Elite CKF90 is a high-quality, high-carbon stick with an Ultimate (24.5mm @ 200mm) or an Xtreme (24.5mm @ 200mm, scoop shaft, flat backhand edge) bend. 
  • It is suitable for an advanced, or aspirational intermediate player, the carbon offers good energy transfer and therefore power for hits and slaps.   • Defenders - ball carriers, elimination skills, push passes, overhead passes, slingshot / sliders / slap-push.
  • Midfield - running skills, elimination, lifted short passes, 3D skills, lifted shots.

nodes.title: Evolution 0.1 Gold 2020
nodes.descriptionHtml:
PRODUCT DETAILS

High Specification, 95% Carbon, Ultimate Bend, elite performance Mercian hockey stick. Designed to maximise energy transfer the Evolution 0.1 has a 95% carbon construction including a Quad Carbon sleeve (braid)* with 5% Aramid (Kevlar) applied to the 3 specific stress points within the stick - heel, back-hand edge & bottom of handle. The Ultimate bend aids drag flicking & 3D skill execution with the active molecule 'piezo-electric fibres' and m-gel silicon sleeve providing vibration damping. An additional feature is the extra cushioned grip created with a 0.75mm PU foam layer beneath the standard super-soft m-tek grip. The new soft touch lacquer used to finish the stick gives enhanced grip on the shaft for both hand & ball. * The Quad Carbon Sleeve is a full-length carbon sock with 3 specific extra sleeves applied to the key stress points in the stick - 4 in total (Quad). The sleeve technology provides the same 360-degree strength seen in braided sticks, enhancing the energy transfer for exceptional hitting power.

  • The Evolution 0.1 is the most aggresive 24.5mm bend that we have ever made, so more info click HERE.

  • This top end stick features a number of materials and finishes such as
    • High Friction Finish
    • Piezo-Electric Fibres
    • Nano-Carbon Technology
    • Nano-Pol resins
    • Cold Satin Laquer Finish

For more information on all the technical details of the stick click HERE

nodes.title: Elite CKF90 (2023) - 90% Carbon, Ultimate & Xtreme Bend Options
nodes.descriptionHtml:
Product Overview:

Mercian CKF90 Hockey Stick - 90% Carbon, Ultimate & Xtreme Bend Options

Experience top-tier performance with the Elite CKF90 Hockey Stick. Designed for advanced and aspiring intermediate players, this stick features a 90% carbon construction with a fibreglass micro-skeleton for exceptional touch and durability. Choose between the Ultimate and Xtreme bends, both optimised for drag-flicking, and 3D skills

Key Features:

  • High-Performance Composition. Crafted with a 90% premium carbon, supported by a fibreglass micro-skeleton and reinforced with Tungsten Carbide Diffused Kevlar for unparalleled durability
  • Ultimate (Extreme) Low Bend. 24.5mm @ 200mm, perfect for enhancing ball control and lift
  • Xtreme Bend: New for 2022/2023, featuring a scooped shaft and thinned toe for improved aerial execution
  • Advanced Vibration Control. Piezo-electric fibres, M-Gel, and EVA under grip reduce vibrations for better handling
  • Nano-Polymer Resin and TCDK. Ensures strength, flexibility, and durability for elite play
  • Ultimate (Extreme) Low Bend. 24.5mm @ 200mm, perfect for enhancing ball control and lift

Why Choose CKF90? Whether you're a defender or a forward, the CKF90 offers powerful energy transfer for hits and slaps while facilitating precise ball movement and control. Elevate your game with the Elite CKF90 Hockey Stick

{"saved":true,"kind":1,"overwrite_styles":false,"inherit_fonts":true,"rounded_corners":true,"disable":false,"font_size":1,"spacing":1,"bold_section_titles":true,"border_color":"#e2e2e2","text_color":"#5e5e5e","heading_color":"#121212","accent_color":"#557b97","accordian_open":2,"accordian_heading_color":"#121212","accordian_icon_color":"#5e5e5e","accordian_side_borders":false,"accordian_multi":false,"accordian_border_color":"#e2e2e2","accordian_bg_color":"rgba(255,255,255,0)","accordian_icon":1,"switcher_style":2,"tabs_bordered":false,"switcher_swipe":false,"bottom_line_text_color":"#121212","bottom_line_color":"#e2e2e2","bottom_line_active_color":"#557b97","bottom_line_inactive_text_color":"#848484","tabs_border_color":"#e2e2e2","tabs_color":"#121212","tabs_bg_color":"rgba(255,255,255,0)","tabs_inactive_color":"#848484","tabs_hover_bg_color":"#f5f5f5","ios_active_bg_color":"#557b97","ios_bg_color":"rgba(255,255,255,0)","ios_active_color":"#fff","ios_color":"#557b97","buttons_active_bg_color":"#557b97","buttons_bg_color":"#f1f1f1","buttons_active_color":"#fff","buttons_color":"#5e5e5e","sections":[{"title":"Description","content":"

The Elite CKF90 is the introductory model in the Elite range, the 90% carbon lay-up is placed across a fibreglass micro-skeleton giving good touch and feel with the Kevlar increasing durability and laminate bonding. The Ultimate (extreme) low bend is designed to aid drag-flicking, aerials and 3D skills. The Xtreme bend available in the CKF90 further enhances the drag-flicking potential of the stick with a scooped shaft, thinned toe, twisted head

  • 90% Carbon
  • Ultimate (Extreme) Low Bend (24.5mm @ 200mm)
  • 3-process vibration control (Piezo-Electric fibres, M-Gel, EVA under grip)
  • Nano-Polymer Resin
  • Tungsten Carbide Diffused Kevlar
","position":0,"chosen":false,"selected":false},{"title":"Technical Details","content":"

ULTIMATE BEND

The Mercian Ultimate Bend is the most aggressive low bow that we have ever made, with the bend of the stick effectively cupping the ball. The maximum bend at this lowest legal point enhances drag ï¬‚icking and aerial skills with the balance point of the stick adjusted to also favour 3D dribbling skills. Whilst the shaft weighting aid sticks head speed it still provides power and balance for the slapping and pushing associated with elite level skill execution.

 

Xtreme Bend â€“ NEW 2022_2023

The Xtreme bend features a number of the popular concepts seen in our other bends in addition to some new elements.

The toe of the stick has been thinned down both on the face and the back of the head to aid getting the ball into the air for 3D skill execution. The backhand zone has been flattened to aid passing and shooting accuracy. The actual bend of the stick (face) is the same as the Ultimate â€“ 24.5mm at a maximum bend point of 200mm from the head. A 2mm concave shaft, with the concave situated above the stick face, so enhancing flicking and â€˜sling-shotâ€™ slapping skills but without compromising the ball / face impact. 4-degree face twist to aid ball handling, dribbling and control on the reverse side. A thinned handle so that with the EVA under grip on the CKF90 the grip dimensions feel â€˜normalâ€™.

 

CARBON FIBRE â€“ CKF90 â€“ 90% Carbon

One of the most common questions asked by the consumer is â€˜how much carbon?â€™ with the perception that more is better. That is far from the truth, so to shed a little light. Firstly, the quality of carbon (manufacturing point) is important. Toray (Japanese) Carbon is often considered the best, but Carbon from Germany, Scotland and South Africa (to name a few) are all high-quality. Sticks are usually made in Pakistan and most major brands will import Carbon into Pakistan to make sticks. Local made carbon is not usually as good. But it is difficult to know if a brand uses imported carbon. The number of filaments in the carbon fibre is relevant, 1K, 3K etc relate to the number of filaments of pure carbon within a fibre or â€˜towâ€™. 1K is used in aeronautical industry and electronics. 3K and 6K are commonly used in sport as they have the right combination of weight and strength. Anything over 6K is very dense and too heavy for sports equipment. Again, this isnâ€™t a common line of questioning from the consumer but may come up. Carbon fibres are a straight-line material and so provide stiffness in a single direction. To provide stiffness in multiple directions the fibre can be woven into a multi-directional sheet (seen as an obvious weave in the sticks surface) or single direction sheets can be layered over each other to create the multi-directional stiffness. 40% of the weight of a composite stick comes from the resin within it. So a stick canâ€™t be 100% carbon. However it can be claimed that 100% of the composite materials in a stick are carbon. Mercian do not believe this gives optimal strength and so always combine the carbon overlay with a composite micro-skeleton made from fibreglass, Kevlar (aramid) and basalt. Carbon is stiff but brittle. The stiffness means that the energy created by the player when striking the ball â€“ hit / slap â€“ transfers to the ball and is not absorbed by the stick. Maximum energy transfer allowed by the FIH is 98%. But this stiffness means that the stick will not absorb energy on trapping / receiving so needs soft hands! The brittleness of carbon means that if the fibres are broken (stick tackle / post impact) they will crack and the stick can or will fail. This is not a manufacturing fault. Other materials can be used in conjunction with carbon to get a positive performance outcome. Special chemicals are used with paints and lacquers to get them to bend to the top layer of carbon and create high-quality graphics. 

 

COLD SATIN LACQUER 

The final coating applied to a stick is usually purely for cosmetic reasons. The Cold Satin Lacquer applied to the Evolution models actually feels different under a player's touch, increasing awareness of temperature and giving the impression of reduced friction for dribbling and stick turn-over. 

 

TCDK (tungsten carbide diffused Kevlar) â€“ CKF90 â€“ 5%

Kevlar is the registered trademark for a para-aramid synthetic fibre, also known simply as ARAMID in other sticks. This high-strength material was first commercially used in the early 1970s as a replacement for steel in racing tires. Typically, it is spun into ropes or fabric sheets that can be used as such or as an ingredient in composite material components. Currently, Kevlar has many applications, including bulletproof vests, because of its high tensile strength-to-weight ratio; by this measure it is 5 times stronger than steel. Tungsten carbide (chemical formula WC) is a chemical compound (specifically, a carbide) containing equal parts of tungsten and carbon atoms. In its most basic form, tungsten carbide is a fine grey powder, Tungsten carbide is approximately twice as strong as steel, For TCDK the fine powder version of WC is diffused through a sheet of Kevlar in the manufacturing process further enhancing the natural characteristics of the material and increasing both its strength and more specifically its durability. 

 

PEIZO-ELECTRIC FIBRES 

Piezo-electric fibres are included in all the Evolution sticks they are used to â€˜harvestâ€™ the vibrations created in these super-stiff sticks and turn them into heat. The result of this is efficient vibration dampening. It's achieved because the molecules within the material are active, the force applied to them (vibrations) causes the fibres to bend and emit a small electric charge that is dispelled as heat. The technology originally used by Head in tennis, applied those forces through an electrode to counter-act the vibrations (this isnâ€™t present in hockey sticks!)

 

NANO-POLYMER RESIN 

The particles within our resins have been altered at a nano-size level (10 x below microscopic) Instead of using nano-carbon particles, the use of rubberized polymers creates a more flexible but stronger bond between the composite layers. This increases the stiffness of the sticks and reduces de-lamination. 

 

FIBREGLASS â€“ CKF90 â€“ 5% FIBREGLASS

The basic synthetic material that makes the initial micro-skeleton in all Mercian composite sticks. Simple fibreglass stands, dipped in custom resins and then woven into sheets to be combined with other materials to create the combinations relative to the specific stickâ€™s performance.

","position":1,"chosen":false,"selected":false},{"title":"Player Profile","content":"
  • The Elite CKF90 is a high-quality, high-carbon stick with an Ultimate (24.5mm @ 200mm) or an Xtreme (24.5mm @ 200mm, scoop shaft, flat backhand edge) bend. 
  • It is suitable for an advanced, or aspirational intermediate player, the carbon offers good energy transfer and therefore power for hits and slaps. The open-face of the Ultimate model helps to lift the ball - drag flicks, 3D skills, aerials, with the additional bend helping stick turnover and therefore lateral ball movement.
  • Defenders - ball carriers, elimination skills, push passes, overhead passes, slingshot / sliders / slap-push.
  • Midfield - running skills, elimination, lifted short passes, 3D skills, lifted shots.
  • Forwards - running elimination skills, lateral dribbles (Indian dribble), lifted slap and hit shooting, easier control because of reduced carbon compared to Elite series.
","position":2}]}

nodes.title: Mercian Evolution CKF90
nodes.descriptionHtml:
The Evolution CKF90 is the premium model in the Evolution range, the 90% carbon lay-up is placed across a fibreglass micro-skeleton giving good touch and feel with the Kevlar increasing durability and laminate bonding. The Ultimate (extreme) low bend is designed to aid drag-flicking, aerials and 3D skills. Introducing a new 'Xtreme' model with concave shaft, reverse hitting edge and low bow.

  • 90% Carbon
  • Ultimate (Extreme) Low Bend (24.5mm @ 200mm) Xtreme Bend (24 mm)
  • 3-process vibration control (Piezo-Electric fibres, M-Gel, EVA under grip)
  • Nano-Polymer Resin
  • Tungsten Carbide Diffused Kevlar

seo.description: The Mercian Evolution CKF90 is an advanced, high carbon, carbon composite hockey stick, suitable for advanced and aspiring players. In its two versions: an ultra low bow, ideal for 3D skills and aerial skills ; an Xtreme bend, low bow with a flat edge to enhance tomahawk and a scoop shaft to aid dragflicking and aerials.
